summary: This is a cover letter from the Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, transmitting the OPR Report of Investigation into the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida's handling of the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and its interactions with victims. The letter notes the public release of the Executive Summary and that the full report may be provided to Congress or released via FOIA requests.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the OPR report cover letter; her office is handling ongoing litigation related to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida is the subject of the OPR report.

events.title: Federal Criminal Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida conducted a federal criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: OPR Report Transmittal and Public Release of Executive Summary
events.description: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility sends its investigation report to Audrey Strauss and publicly releases the Executive Summary of the report.

locations: 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 3266 Washington, D.C. 20530 (DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York City, NY 10007 (United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
Southern District of Florida (location of the investigated U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed an investigation into the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida's handling of the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.
The investigation also examined the office's interactions with victims during the Epstein investigation.
The Executive Summary of the OPR report was publicly released on November 12, 2020.
The full OPR report was not publicly released at that time but could be provided to Congress or released via FOIA requests.
The matter has received extraordinary public attention and been the subject of Congressional inquiries.
